body: I don't really understand what you're trying to do — why are you setting `server.base` in your Vite config? `paths.base` in your Svelte config is only needed if you're _deploying_ your app to a `/build` path, it's nothing to do with the fact that `adapter-static` creates a `build` directory.

issue.title: always add trailing slash to base path
issue.body:
fixes #9341.

In #9220, we changed the logic for resolving asset paths to accommodate the `relative: true` option, and included [special handling](https://github.com/sveltejs/kit/pull/9220/files#r1120243235) for the case where you're rendering the root page when `base` is set — if the base path is `/a/b/c` and you render `/a/b/c`, then the relative path (somewhat counter-intuitively) needs to be `./c` for links to work.

Turns out that was a mistake, because the root should always end with a trailing slash — if you prerender that page, it will be output as `<output>/index.html`, and relative paths will thus be incorrectly converted to `<output>/c/...`.

The fix is to remove the special case handling, and ensure that `/a/b/c` always redirects to `/a/b/c/`. This is much simpler and more correct. It arguably falls into the semver gray zone where someone somewhere might be relying on the buggy behaviour, but I think it's vanishingly unlikely, and in any case the worst that will happen is a URL that used to render something gets turned into a redirect.

### Please don't delete this checklist! Before submitting the PR, please make sure you do the following:
- [x] It's really useful if your PR references an issue where it is discussed ahead of time. In many cases, features are absent for a reason. For large changes, please create an RFC: https://github.com/sveltejs/rfcs
- [x] This message body should clearly illustrate what problems it solves.
- [x] Ideally, include a test that fails without this PR but passes with it.

### Tests
- [x] Run the tests with `pnpm test` and lint the project with `pnpm lint` and `pnpm check`

### Changesets
- [x] If your PR makes a change that should be noted in one or more packages' changelogs, generate a changeset by running `pnpm changeset` and following the prompts. Changesets that add features should be `minor` and those that fix bugs should be `patch`. Please prefix changeset messages with `feat:`, `fix:`, or `chore:`.

body:
Dear @Rich-Harris,
thanks for the fix!
It's much appreciated!

Unfortunately not fixed (for me) in PR 9343:
https://github.com/sveltejs/kit/pull/9343#issuecomment-1462459828

I stumbled upon this problem when following several guides on how to use SvelteKit to generate static website for Github Pages. The guides say to use static adapter, add `paths.base` with repository's name like `/my-repo`, also as some more things.

So, the dot prefix appears for CSS/JS files, which on Github Pages cause the base path to be added twice (like `...github.io/my-repo/my-repo/_app/...`), therefore not loading said files at all. Removing `paths.base` setting resolves the problem.

Thank you @SirRFI ! Removing paths.base from svelte.config.js also seems to fix my github-page. But after analysis, this isn't a good fix as favicon and other images coming from static are not found anymore. I'm using SvelteKit 1.12.

Removing paths.base from svelte.config.js just fixed apparently the issue with the root/first page but favicon and other links to static-content are broken. Personally, I have re-enabled the paths.base and have the bug on the root/first page. Notice that the other pages do not have the issue. And if you visit the root/first page from an other page, you also don't have the issue.

This issue of not finding js and css because of wrong path "mybase/mybase" is visible on github page but also locally if you add a trailing / in the url of the browser.
> localhost:4173/mybase : doesn't have the issue
> localhost:4173/mybase/ : has the issue
> localhost:4173/mybase/otherpage : doesn't have the issue
> localhost:4173/mybase/otherpage/ : ask for redirection
This bug seems to be preventing me from deploying to GitHub Pages. I'm trying https://kit.svelte.dev/docs/adapter-static#github-pages

> This bug seems to be preventing me from deploying to GitHub Pages. I'm trying https://kit.svelte.dev/docs/adapter-static#github-pages

It seems to be that just setting the base to "" works. Therefore, I suggest that the docs be updated

> 

That was also my first impression. But this workaround has lot of side effects as mentioned above. The root cause of the issue is triggered by the trailing slash imposed by the redirection of github-page.

issue.title: Update 50-adapter-static.md
issue.body:
Since a SvelteKit update (probably 1.9.0), the `path` property isn't needed anymore because it leads to a 404 request, since it tries to request a file that doesn't exist. See also #9341 . Can anyone confirm this issue and confirm that the version that introduced it is 1.9.0 ?

### Please don't delete this checklist! Before submitting the PR, please make sure you do the following:
- [x] It's really useful if your PR references an issue where it is discussed ahead of time. In many cases, features are absent for a reason. For large changes, please create an RFC: https://github.com/sveltejs/rfcs
- [x] This message body should clearly illustrate what problems it solves.
- [x] Ideally, include a test that fails without this PR but passes with it.

### Tests
- [x] Run the tests with `pnpm test` and lint the project with `pnpm lint` and `pnpm check`

### Changesets
- [x] If your PR makes a change that should be noted in one or more packages' changelogs, generate a changeset by running `pnpm changeset` and following the prompts. Changesets that add features should be `minor` and those that fix bugs should be `patch`. Please prefix changeset messages with `feat:`, `fix:`, or `chore:`.

body:
> Unfortunately not fixed (for me) in PR 9343: [#9343 (comment)](https://github.com/sveltejs/kit/pull/9343#issuecomment-1462459828)

After the rescuing hint by Rich Harris ( https://github.com/sveltejs/kit/pull/9343#issuecomment-1490967570 ) everything works fine for me in the current Sveltekit 1.15 as in the branch of the PR.

Thanks for your help!

sveltekit 1.15.6 fix the issue of the github-page. But I see locally a new issue: when loading "localhost:4173/mybase", js-module are blocked because of a disallowed MIME type (“”).
Notice that "localhost:4173/mybase/" (i.e. with trailing slash) doesn't have the issue.
`Loading module from “http://localhost:4173/_app/immutable/entry/start.96119e73.js” was blocked because of a disallowed MIME type (“”).`

issue.title: Adapter-static not applying CSS on index page
issue.body:
### Describe the bug

This is what I expect:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/110659061/224484868-b59c3c28-2e5a-41a5-b6c7-7810cef0b4ba.png)

But when I upload it to [Github pages](https://universallyleo.github.io/testapp/), the index page has no CSS applied to it:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/110659061/224484932-93be9f18-23c2-4669-b8d9-994704141059.png)

The strange thing is that CSS get applies correctly on other pages, only the index page (i.e. from ` src/+page.svelte`) has this problem.  Even stranger is if I click a link to go to another page, and then click a link coming back to the index page, the CSS will be applied!  You can see this on my [demo pages](https://universallyleo.github.io/testapp/).  Can anyone explains why this is happening?

The build produce no error of course.  It is the final result that is the problem.

There was no such problem before on my old project (built around the time when SvelteKit1.0 comes out).  But when I update my npm packages everything breaks.  So I start afresh and checked that I really doesn't show the way I expect.  If any of my steps is wrong, perhaps some clarification in the documentation will be very helpful.  Perhaps some clarification on the correct steps to how to update the svelte packages in the documentation will be helpful too.

### Reproduction

[Link](https://github.com/universallyleo/testapp) to the repo containing the demo. 

This is how I come to it:
1. `npm create svelte@latest testapp`
2. `npm install`
3. `npm i @sveltejs/adapter-static`
4. change `svelte.config.js` as follows
```
import adapter from "@sveltejs/adapter-static";

const dev = process.argv.includes("dev");

/** @type {import('@sveltejs/kit').Config} */
const config = {
    kit: {
        // adapter-auto only supports some environments, see https://kit.svelte.dev/docs/adapter-auto for a list.
        // If your environment is not supported or you settled on a specific environment, switch out the adapter.
        // See https://kit.svelte.dev/docs/adapters for more information about adapters.
        adapter: adapter({
            pages: "docs",
            assets: "docs",
        }),
        paths: {
            base: dev ? "" : "/testapp",
        },
    },
};

export default config;
```
5. Add `export const prerender=true` to `+layout.js`
6. Add `+layout.svelte` and style it (this is where the CSS are set).
7. Add another page `about/+page.svelte` to demonstrate that the CSS get applies correctly on the non-index page
8. Add a blank `.nojekyll` to static folder
9. `npm run dev` checked it is producing the result I wanted
10. `npm run build` to built to docs folder
11. Upload to repo to Github and have Github Page points to docs 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/110659061/224485240-b16c1097-5cf8-4102-b46c-184c0d2c8ba8.png)
12. Check result on [Github pages](https://universallyleo.github.io/testapp/) 



### Logs

_No response_

### System Info

```Shell
System:
    OS: Windows 10 10.0.19045
    CPU: (12) x64 Intel(R) Core(TM) i7-8700 CPU @ 3.20GHz
    Memory: 2.93 GB / 15.81 GB
  Binaries:
    Node: 18.9.0 - C:\Program Files\nodejs\node.EXE
    Yarn: 1.22.19 - ~\AppData\Roaming\npm\yarn.CMD
    npm: 9.4.2 - C:\Program Files\nodejs\npm.CMD
  Browsers:
    Chrome: 111.0.5563.64
    Edge: Spartan (44.19041.1266.0), Chromium (110.0.1587.63)
    Internet Explorer: 11.0.19041.1566
  npmPackages:
    @sveltejs/adapter-auto: ^2.0.0 => 2.0.0
    @sveltejs/adapter-static: ^2.0.1 => 2.0.1
    @sveltejs/kit: ^1.5.0 => 1.11.0
    svelte: ^3.54.0 => 3.56.0
    vite: ^4.0.0 => 4.1.4
```


### Severity

annoyance
